intro: Selinum turcomanicum, commonly known as the Turkestan parsley, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It is often found in rocky or sandy areas, and its growth habit is perennial. The plant is valued for its aromatic foliage and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
